text: Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is very citrus, lemon, floral. Taste is sour, crisp, hop funk. Overall, okay.

Bottle at James 10k tasting. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Musk and citrus on the nose, soft musk and melon. Medium bodied, tangy acid and tartness all the way through. Beautiful, lots of acid, bright and tangy.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2015 Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. A big sweet funky lemon nose. The flavor is big sweet funky malts, lemons, zesty, vanilla. Wow. For the abv..this is awesome. Just a super smooth tropical funky bit of goodness.

Bottle from Doug. Thanks! 

A: Semi - opaque with a thin white head.

N: Pineapple, lemon, grapefruit, some pine and earth, hint of lime, 

T: Tart and a bit sweet. Light bitter.

M: Light body, crisp carbonation, no alcohol. 

O: Very good berliner. The hopping lends a tasty citrus to this. A worthy one from DG.

Very very pale and cloudy white pour with a thin white head. Tropical fruit and dry citrus with lemon, lychee, light cedar. Very tart and dry with citrus and tropical fruit and very dry acidity. Light bodied.

Draft at de Garde (2/15/15), from notes. Hazy straw colored pour with white head and sheets of lacing. Bright weedy, hoppy nose. My wife comments "radler?" and yeah, I sorta get that, actually. Lemon, grass, herbal, weedy, wheat. Interesting interplay vs. the base. Restrained tartness, light bitterness, lightly sweet. Slick texture, light body. Overall impression: hoppy carbonated pickle juice.

Bottle - thanks Matt! Pours hazy straw, large white head, creamy, slow to dissipate, nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, passion fruit, grape fruit, lemon, spruce. Flavor is light plus tart, fruity, lemon, citrus. Light body, effervescent. Totally yummy, and amazing beer achievement for 2.3%

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of very nice hops, farm, fruits. Taste is of sourness, acidity, some bitterness, wheat, fruits, citrus. Palate: Light body. Light-medium carbonation. Overall: Quite nice. Sourness under controll. Nice citrus.
Cloudy pineapple look. Great pineapple and hop aroma. Excellent mild sourness.amazing with funk finis.johns bottle.

Hazy straw colour pour, fast disappearing head. Hoppy aroma, tart lemon, lighter barnyard notes. Taste is the same, significant hop bitterness, pineapple, tart, lemon, funk. Light body. Insanely drinkable.

Bottle (750 ml). From Thomas, thanks! Split 5-ways.

Appearance: Slightly hazy bright pale yellow with a small white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Bright citrusy/lemony aroma with lactic notes, a nice farmhouse character, interesting juicy hops and nice oak presence.

Taste: Quite lemony and lactic as well with nice juiciness (pineapples, lemon), light but effective grains backbone, some farmhouse characted and well integrated oak. Mild spiciness.

Palate: Very light body, but not watery. Moderate carbonation. Rather dry and quite lemony finish. 

Overall: Finally, another good De Garde. After so many letdown, its nice to get a nice surprise. Similar profile to Hill Farmstead/Mikkeller Wheat is the New Hops. Bright aroma, super easy drinking and quenching and so tasty that you could never tell this is only 2.3 % abv.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours unclear very pale yellow with a small white cap, reviving and leaving and quite nice lacing. minty green hops, grassy and juicy, soft oak, pineapple, tart peaches, citrus, light wheaty notes - never husky, peppery and spicy touch; pale maltiness - sour cereals. light carbonation, light body - never watery, maybe a bit more body from hop oils; pleasantly tart and spicy-citrusy finish. excellent berliner. the best offering ive had from de garde to date.

Pours a hazy yellow with no head (and no retention at all) and no lacing. Nose is of nice juicy hops and fruity. Taste is of lemon, lactic acid and hops. Body is light, carbonation moderately high and it is clean and refreshing. Acidity level is good and not aggressive like on a lot of the De Garde beers we have tried so far. Really good!

Bottle shared. Hazy gold pour with bubbly white head. Aroma is really fun, nice winey hop notes, light oak, citrusy, lemongrass, light lactic notes. Taste is tart, lemony, citric acidity, really nice. Palate is light dry, but not watery, light carbonation. Really good, nice surprise from de Garde.

Bottle shared at 10k as were so many bus smells of weed (why am I getting this everywhere as of late), tropical fruit. Tastes just lovely of pineapple, lactose, grassy, zesty spice, an lemonade. Fine spritzy palate. Lovely.
Bottle. 10K share. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of lemon, lactose, oak, grassy hop, citrus funk. Lighter bodied.

Bottle at clockworks 10k. Pours a bright hazy golden body with thin white lacing. Aroma is funky dough and peach skins. Mouthfeel is medium to sort with notes of sour lemonade, peach skins and sour dough.
Bottle. Light golden pour with white head. Citrus, herbal hop aromas. Citrus hop, citrus fruit, funk and bright sour tones.

Smell is light hops and light tropical aromas. Taste is a nice mild sourness, a very mild hop note, refreshing lemon lime citrus, and some very mild yeasty berliner note in the aftertaste. Super sharp medium carbonation with very mild foam.

Hazy straw colored body with a medium sized fizzy white head and spotty lacing. Bright pineapple hop notes followed by classic lemon and lactic wheat, rounded out with a light pine and floral character. Light bodied with lively carbonation and assertive acidity. Diggin this.

Bottle from the brewery, Tillamook. Pours a very pale straw color, pretty good amount of head, lots of retention, to my surprise. Aroma pleasant, with some grassy notes mixed in with tropical fruit. Body lively with a finish reminiscent of orange zest, just a bit of tartness as well. Subtly complex, if a wee bit sweet. Nice.

750 ml bottle supplied by Ajax, thanks man! Aroma is fresh lemons, grass and mild, faint pine, really pleasant. The flavor has a mild lingering oak, mild tart lemons with light and refreshing tart and sour finish. Crisp.
Poured from bottle thanks AdamJackson. Hazy lemon color with thin white head. Smells awesome like fresh citrus and pine. Taste is juicy hop and tart lemon. Very refreshing.

Very hazy, looks like fresh lemon juice. Smells fantastic. Really bright fruity with pine needle american hops. Earthy with some citrus and pineapple. Very refreshing. Like a light lemon juice, some strange maybe chalk like taste at the finish but the taste is crisp, tart, Very tart at the finish. nice beer.
Bottle..Pour is yellow..Nose is nice hop spice, funk, lemon, oak, ...Taste is grassy, hop spice, oak, lemon, ginger? , herbal...
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical hop and oak. Thin mouth, juicy hop, light tartness, crushable, really nice.

[2/28/15] Draught at De Garde Brewing in Tillamook. Release and bottle share event. Nice cloudy pale yellow with a big white head. Aroma of green and fruity hops, flowers and fart. Sour lactic flavor with some barnyard, green hops, a bit floral, nice fruitiness and a bitter note. Rather light-bodied.
Another 22shared at a tasting. I think I just dislike de Gardes hoppy stuff. The lactic and hop characters come off as pissy, cheesy, and soapy. Otherwise, the base berliner is stellar as usual.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: HOMG 2015. Thanks EricTeusink. Really nice and tight aroma. Tropical tangerine and lemon. Very effervescent, dry, refreshing. The hops give this way more personality and presence than the alcohol percentage will have you believe.

HMOG 2015. Big ups for ericteusink popping my de garde cherry. In a day where 10% was the norm this maybe the lowest alcohol beer Iver ever had (barring NAs). Tart citrus, grassy and citrus hops. Lively carbonation and a palate cutter when it was needed in the worst way. Love it for what it is and love the low alcohol. Now would I spend $10 a pop on these to drink all day? NO. But, certainly a fun thing to mix in.
Draft - bright grassy, citrus and some peel. Pale yellow with a rich white head. Grass, pine, herbal and a lemon dry finish.

Poured from tap to glass. Straw hue with fizzy white head that dissipated. Aroma is lactic, grass, grapefruit, mango. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is tart throughout with a bitterness in the finish. Overall this is a fun brew.
